display.text: Find what you love and let it kill you.
display.author: Charles Bukowski

display.text: She wasn’t afraid to be herself. It was everyone else who couldn’t handle it.
display.author: Bukowski (paraphrased)

display.text: Don’t bend; don’t water it down; don’t try to make it logical; don’t edit your own soul according to the fashion. Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly.
display.author: Franz Kafka

display.text: You have your brush, you have your colors, you paint paradise, then in you go.
display.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

display.text: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
display.author: Sigmund Freud

display.text: Live the full life of the mind, exhilarated by new ideas, intoxicated by the Romance of the unusual.
display.author: Ernest Hemingway

display.text: You deserve someone who speaks to you in their favorite words.
display.author: Perry Poetry

display.text: The world was made more beautiful the moment you arrived.
display.author: Unknown

display.text: Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard.
display.author: Kurt Vonnegut

display.text: I swear I couldn’t love you more than I do right now, and yet I know I will tomorrow.
display.author: Leo Christopher

display.text: If I had a flower for every time I thought of you, I could walk through my garden forever.
display.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

display.text: You are the calm after the storm, the place my heart feels most like home.
display.author: J. Iron Word

display.text: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
display.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, 'The Little Prince'

display.text: Your voice is my favorite sound, and your name is my favorite word.
display.author: Unknown

display.text: Even in the silence, you are my favorite song.
display.author: Unknown

display.text: You are the poem I never knew how to write, and this life is the story I have always wanted to tell.
display.author: Tyler Knott Gregson

display.text: Darling, you are all the things I never knew I was brave enough to want.
display.author: Beau Taplin

display.text: You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
display.author: Rumi

display.text: And in her smile I see something more beautiful than the stars.
display.author: Beth Revis

display.text: I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart).
display.author: E. E. Cummings

display.text: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
display.author: Emily Brontë

display.text: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination.
display.author: Roman Payne

display.text: I want to be with those who know secret things or else alone.
display.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

display.text: There is no remedy for love but to love more.
display.author: Henry David Thoreau

display.text: I didn’t need you to fix me, I needed you to love me while I rebuilt myself.
display.author: Unknown

display.text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
display.author: David Viscott

display.text: You touched me and suddenly I was a lilac sky.
display.author: Lana Del Rey

display.text: You are the best thing I never planned.
display.author: Unknown

display.text: Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage.
display.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

display.text: I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once.
display.author: John Green

display.text: If you remember me, then I don’t care if everyone else forgets.
display.author: Haruki Murakami

display.text: Love her but leave her wild.
display.author: Atticus

favorites.text: Find what you love and let it kill you.
favorites.author: - Charles Bukowski
